intro: Swallenia alexandrae, commonly known as the Alexandra's bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet petals. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Swallenia alexandrae is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
